body.p: In developing that exposure draft, the Board considered three ways of determining a deemed cost of an investment in a subsidiary at the parent’s date of transition to IFRSs in its separate financial statements. These were:

li.p: the previous GAAP cost of the investment (previous GAAP deemed cost).
the parent’s interest in the subsidiary’s assets less liabilities, using the carrying amounts that IFRSs would require in the subsidiary’s statement of financial position (net asset deemed cost).
the fair value of the investment (fair value deemed cost).
